com.sagar.lockpattern_gridview

Class PatternGridView

  • java.lang.Object
    • android.view.View
      • com.sagar.lockpattern_gridview.PatternGridView
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    android.graphics.drawable.Drawable.Callback, android.view.accessibility.AccessibilityEventSource, android.view.KeyEvent.Callback, PatternInterface

    public class PatternGridView
extends android.view.View
implements PatternInterface
    Created by aravind on 20/9/14. A view which implements a pattern lock grid, like pattern lock in android lock screen

    • Method Detail

      • init

        private void init()
        Setting up the various paint objects

      • getPatternType

        public int getPatternType()
        Description copied from interface: PatternInterface
        Returns the patternType. Pattern type is basically a "theme" for the view. 2 types are supported as of now, PATTERN_TYPE_CHECK, which is suitable to be used over a dark background, and PATTERN_TYPE_STORE, which is suitable to be drawn over a light background.

        The names come from the colors used in setting and getting pattern in Android L(preview) ;)

        Specified by:
        getPatternType in interface PatternInterface
        Returns:
        the current pattern type

      • setPatternType

        public void setPatternType(int mPatternType)
        Description copied from interface: PatternInterface
        Set the current pattern type. Pattern type is basically a "theme" for the view. 2 types are supported as of now, PATTERN_TYPE_CHECK, which is suitable to be used over a dark background, and PATTERN_TYPE_STORE, which is suitable to be drawn over a light background.

        The names come from the colors used in setting and getting pattern in Android L(preview) ;)

        Specified by:
        setPatternType in interface PatternInterface
        Parameters:
        mPatternType - new type to be set.

      • isInputEnabled

        public boolean isInputEnabled()
        Description copied from interface: PatternInterface
        Returns whether touch input is enabled for the view
        Specified by:
        isInputEnabled in interface PatternInterface
        Returns:
        true, if the view is accepting touches, false, if the view is ignoring them

      • setInputEnabled

        Sets whether the view should process or ignore the touches

        public void clearPattern()

      • getPattern

        public java.util.List<java.lang.Integer> getPattern()
        Description copied from interface: PatternInterface
        Get the last pattern entered in the View.
        Specified by:
        getPattern in interface PatternInterface
        Returns:
        the last pattern; It is returned as an ordered list of numbers, each number represents a particular cell in the pattern grid

      • setRingColor

        public void setRingColor(int color)
        Description copied from interface: PatternInterface
        Sets the color of the ring around the dots in the path entered. This color is applied only when the pattern has been set. While the user is still drawing, the color shown will depend upon the theme set in the layout xml file or using PatternInterface.setPatternType(int) This color is also applied to the indicator arrows whenever it is applied to the rings
        Specified by:
        setRingColor in interface PatternInterface
        Parameters:
        color - The color to be set

      • setPatternListener

        public void setPatternListener(PatternInterface.PatternListener listener)
        Description copied from interface: PatternInterface
        Set the callbacks for different events such as PatternGridView.PatternState.IN_PROGRESS, PatternGridView.PatternState.ENTERED, PatternGridView.PatternState.BLANK
        Specified by:
        setPatternListener in interface PatternInterface
        Parameters:
        listener - An instance of a class which implements PatternInterface.PatternListener
